intro: Sauropus albicans, commonly known as the white-veined sauropus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, lance-shaped leaves with distinctive white veins. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often hidden among the foliage. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in gardens.
